column11: Review Text

column8: Marino Beach Hotel - A top-rated hotel in Colombo.
column11: Marino Beach stands out for its excellent location, clean and spacious rooms, and a spectacular rooftop infinity pool with ocean views. It‚Äôs connected to a shopping mall, making dining and shopping convenient. It also offers complimentary city tours and access to private beach lounge. Staff are friendly and professional. The breakfast buffet gets high marks for variety and quality.

I came here for a lovely evening for a cup of tea and I encountered a lovely employee named Sathsara who was kind and really friendly with a really good hospitality and excellent service. Whenever we come here he gives the best service highly appreciate it

column8: Great Value at the Food Court
column11: The food court offers a great selection of food and drinks that are definitely worth the price. The portions are generous, the quality is good and there‚Äôs something for everyone. I was especially impressed with how fresh everything tasted. It‚Äôs a convenient spot for a quick bite without breaking the bank. I‚Äôd definitely come back for another meal!

column8: Definitely not a mall Worth visiting
column11: Not too many options . The stores are in deed away pricey. Hardly few shops to be qualified to call it self a mall . The food court has only few options for dining .

column8: Good stop if already in area
column11: Plenty of shops, the more interesting are on the first floor. The second floor is mostly clothes and then floors 3+ are furniture shops. Good selection of items, even for a tourist. Don't necessarily go just for this, but if you're in the area then why not

column8: Really beautiful view of the ocean
column11: A small and cool mall with some clothing stores of appliances, traditional, a games room, and some restaurants gathered in a single room (the Emporium), where you can enjoy cocktails, eat rice curry or ice cream. The mall is set in the grand hotel of the same name. We were there for lunch. A bit difficult to choose, since at each corner of the Emporium they offer different food but no menu on display (no problem seeing it if you request). The food then is good quality with average prices. Really nice view of the ocean.

column8: Best place to be happy and chill. Higly recommend .üòçüòçüòç‚ú®ü•∞ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥
column11: Marino world is the best place to be happy and they provide good customer service. The staff here are very good and help a lot even for those who don't know how to play games. I highly recommend here for those who like to have fun.üòä

column8: a middle size mall with good enough products specially high quality made in Sri Lanka ones
column11: A friendly place with good prices. Specially the big shop in second floor has a diversity of all kinds of clothes with polite store staff.

Lovely mall, alot of excitment and fun, in the heart of colombo 03, surrounded by exciting places to go, great atmosphere. Would recommend to anyone, also 10% discounts if staying at hotel and shopping in the mall.
Average mall for Asian standards but not necessary to visit if you are a tourist. No special foods, no special retail. Probably a mall for locals or people who live and work in Colombo

Lovely new mall, cool and fairly quiet.  We enjoyed lots of meals in their food centre, (we tried Sri Lankan, Chinese and India) and did lots of shopping at Diligence on the floors above.  The coffee shop served great  cappuccinos, I was a bit apprehensive but this was the best I had in Sri Lanka.  Roots juice bar was a good choice for desserts, lovely ice cream.

Nothing interesting in this mall. Few stores on the ground floor. First floor is dedicated to one department store while the floors above are all furniture. Food court is not good at all. Food is not tasty. Service is slow. It looks like although they show there are different food outlets based on different cuisines (everything is cooked inside the same kitchen) - thus the delay and food being cold.

We frequent this mall a lot, and it is actually quite good. Several shops on the first floor including an electronics shop, souvenirs, toys, a food court and an amusment center. Prices are quite okay, just right and not as expensive as the Shangrila mall (One Galle); there is a vast department store from the second floor up, where you can find almost anything. What is lacking though, and perhaps a future draw - would be supermarket. Overall, this is a pretty decent and nice mall to lounge about if you have some free time and looking for some things to buy.
Newish mall in Colombo Good security at entry , has large shopping mall Some good food outlets for snacks and ice cream Fully AC

Very good service and excellent customer service, Miss Umega helped in searching new designs of bridal jewellery and helped in searching modern designs of men's bracelets, she did her level best in her service and in our side. She was kind to all our family members and talked innocently. Rated highly in her service and highly rates Vogue Jewellers

This is a small shopping mall attached to the Marino Beach Hotel. It is a very clean mall, with AC and a good range of shops. There is a very good clothes shop on the upper floor, which has a very good range of clothes. Well worth a visit on a hot and humid day, lol. There is a kids entertainment area which is handy.
Excellent food and very hard working and friendly staff. Good place to hang out with friends and family. Worth for money.

Marino mall food court, value for money. Very spacious and clean,  staff very friendly, I want to Thank Dasun, for  his great service and hospitality, always willing to help and always with a smile, keep up the great work. You are a great asset to the food court. Thank you. Will recommend.
Average western style mall with western style food stall. It a good place to hang out during heat time but I prefer the traditional Sri Lankan food hence this is not for me.

The mall it self is quite average. But the food court has variety and is economical. It is a grate place to take the kids and go for a mini-outing as it offers a Virtual Gaming Zone as well as the Food Court. If you are expecting a Mall experience this is not the place.
Its a standard mall for economic shopping. Not as big as you see in many cities. But rates are good. A bit of food courts

I recently visited the shopping mall, it looks very modern outside but gives the usual feeling of a shopping mall inside. The places lacks a good variety of shops and the composition of a single clothing store on the 1st floor is quite depressing as it leaves a very low or no room for variety on that level. The gaming area is the place which attracts people because of the lights and the looks of a digital world it showcase. I personally doesn't feel going there 2nd time because of the boring layout inside but this place can be renovated with a different layout to supress its competitors.

Super awesome location for spending your time with your family. Many games are available at the game zone, which your children would love to play. Shopping can be done under a decent price. I would recommend for more visitors.
I recently visited Marino Mall in Colombo. It is a nice clean mall with great AC. It has quite a good range of shops and a food court. Worth a short visit if you are in the area

Visited the above restaurant.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The music was loud and they organized dinner for us at a more quieter place with softer music which we enjoyed so much. The food was very good and the portions big. Prices very reasonable. The sauces that accompanied the food was amazing. We enjoyed our dinner and wanted coffee which was a disaster. It was over priced and the cuppuccino was terrible. The worst I have ever had. The ambiance is very good. We will go again only to have the food.

Opened in late July 2018, the 12 storey, 150,000 square foot Marino Mall, developed by Damro, together with the Marino Beach Hotel, presumably as a new flagship store, contains several floors displaying Damro products. There are also many exclusive stores on the other floors here, a 9D cinema, VR Games and Kids Areas, and a food court. The Mall is spacious, clean, bright and cool, a great place just to wander around. A fine view of the sunset over the Indian Ocean is available, at no extra cost, from rooftop Sky Park. We only went for a look and a stroll, but bought a 3 piece suite. It was an expensive visit.
This mall has variety of shops to shop around and a nice restaurants including a play area and a movie theater! Nice place to roam around with your loved ones and get your shopping done nicely!
There was a good variety of shops in the mall as well as a few other activities such as movies, etc.

I loved my stay at Marino Beach for many reasons. Looking at a weekend getaway and I managed to have a good time with my family in Colombo, than travelling out. Loved the time at Rooftop - Sky Park. Views are simply amazing!!! There are many spots you could view a perfect sunset. Amazing Food, and many options to select from.

Since my last visit and the terrorist attacks at Easter the security at the mall has increased with more thorough bag checks at the entrance. Shopping is limited to a relatively small number of outlets but the clothes store Diliganz has some fashionable items for men, women and children at reasonable prices (but don't expect to find large sizes!!) The food court still popular with sundowners My friend enjoyed the VR car chase in the "gaming area" (400 rupees a go)
Went there to check out the food court. Food was quite nice.  Had a pretty good selection. Nice view of the sea as well.

You can go for shopping,  Restaurants, hotel and pool, and playing area. Super  clean  place . Very peacefully can  enjoy  in the restaurant. Marine moll has both sides entrance, Gall road and the  marine  drive. Food is well standed. I love this place

The mall has several floors filled with shopping. The floors at the bottom have some upscale (expensive) shops. There is also a VR game section plus a section for children. The food court is okay - nothing to rave about. I tried placing an order at the Indian restaurant - they said it would take minimum 30 minutes to serve. And the restaurant was half-full! Went to an ice-cream shop (also at the mall) and they said they would accept only Sri Lankan currency - no credit cards even! There is a pub - Floatz - on the top floor and a couple of restaurants, which the mall shares with the adjoining hotel.
Lot of good brands on offer. Shops are well stocked. Electronic game arcade very good. Food court has a lot of good dishes to select from. Good mocktails too. Desserts good.

I have visited there with my friend for coffee on one late evening, but we were experienced VR stuffs before have coffees,and we enjoyed it well, Marino mall is a fully facilitated mall, it contains everything parking, ATM‚Äôs, cafeteria,,,etc. there cafeteria is more attractive than any other places. It‚Äôs situated on the same level to the sea, it seems to be like we‚Äôre sitting on the sea, btw I put only three stars there because there was so much rush inside, like more than the capacity, maybe its because its so new to Colombo, but it was really annoying, and prices need to be get lower for everything, but I can‚Äôt say bad at all because they are so young to Colombo, there will be all good soon

While in Colombo, took our extended family to Marino Mall. Tbh there is nothing great to talk about. Some shops with expensive price tags, many shops are yet to open, not much welcoming food stalls in the food court area, and we felt it‚Äôs kind of oppressing atmosphere The only attraction is the Marine Drive open area, where they have an observation/cafe verandah, you can sit and relax with a coffee or tea. Before you enter, there is a high checking by the security officials. Baggage, screening entrance and then a manual checking. But the guards and staffs are friendly
Hi, We had buffet with family and the food was awesome. Service is great. Keep up the good work. Worth the price. So satisfied.
Really good and a  very convenient place to  stay and rest... Good rooms with nice views are available... loved it

We are two ladies, friends and expats in Lanka working in here.  We know in this country the apparence are not reable expecially when you are looking for professional beauty  treatment. My friend and I we came in Marino Mall to look for place to make manicure and pedicure, gel treatment both. We asked to make the French nail gel and the semipermanent nail they proposed us the CUCCIO‚Äôs nail color ,  the staff said that the quality of the brand was very good and we started to remove the old gel on our nails. We understood after they weren‚Äôt not able to do it and they didn‚Äôt know how to manage safely this work. After they removed the our old color gel, breaking our nails and getting pains us, they informed us they finished the gel to make the French  style, we decide to go to normal color for feet and to make french and to make the semipermanent pink color for hands nail . The bill was really expensive, more than 10.000 rupies , more than 50 eur. We lost all nail color at home, at the same evening time and morning after  . In Colombo you can find Shellac service, OPI service in Unity Plaza and Crescat Boulevard, we suggest you go trough only these 2 Saloon and never use the not professional places as FRANGE BY NAYANA, in MARINO MALL , we were unluky , in the POYA DAY Holiday we found the only open hope the FRANGE BY Nayana, hope the  quality control of THE MARINO MALL go to check. The level of this manicure and pedicure were the worst in our life .

We have been to the Bharath Bhojan a couple of times and thoroughly enjoyed their food.  Their Naans and Butter Chicken are just awesome.  Will have it anytime.  Recently we tasted the Biriyani which is really good too. Nice place to walk around and do some shopping.  The Ice Cream and Doughnut outlets are good too.  Love it. The play area is good for the kids (and the ones who want to a be a kid all over again)  if they want to take a challenge. Just hope that the Complex will be maintained on a regular basis.
It‚Äôs cool small mall with a hotel. Shops and small food court. Having cool view of the seaside and the rail. It use to be nearby from my hotel.
It's a nice place to hangout, have a cup of tea and have some snacks as well. They have a lot of stalls in the food court.

This mall is one of widest in Colombo. Newly Opened one. Clam & Quite environment is happy to stay with relaxing the mind. Yes, it's a nice place to spend the time also tasty food with reasonable price. Food court having western, eastern. Middle East, Far East, Indian .. like several verities. few times we went there & had most of them. It's worth to spend money. we can relax our mind with a beachside view attached to the Food court area. I love to go there with my friends or my family.

Relatively a new addition to greater Colombo during latter part of 2019. This shopping mall is attached to Marion Beach hotel. It has a fair collection of clothing, accessories, souvenir and home appliances. Food court has separated sections for Sri Lankan, Western, Arabic, Indian and Eastern Asian cuisines. Also some small shops with pastries, snacks, desserts and a fresh juice bar. Ceylon tea lovers can taste some freshly brewed cup of tea at the dedicated tea stall at this food court. Tea pot for 02 is about USD 2 and take away tea packs are available to purchase. Tea stall is ideal for a quick meet up as well. It has the option for indoor meals and outdoor section facing Indian oceans. Also, will get view of train passing along the coastal railway line. Overall nice place to have a good meal and affordable shopping.
Their food court  has got a variety of sections including, Western, Middleast, Far-east, Indian and Sri Lankan. Its worth the money.

We were staying at the Marino Beach Hotel and attached to it is the Marino mall with a small food court.  But it was so cheap and had loads of different options.  We went both nights we atyed as we had sunset drinks at the pool first!

We went to shopping in Marino mall which is newly opened.  It has everything. 9D movies. Games, food cord, tea lounge and lots... you have to go and see. You will love it. Will go back again. Nice staff with smile. Keep going. Good luck.

When we arrived the outdoor terrace of the Food Court was awash with visitors aiming to get photos of the sun setting over the Indian Ocean whilst locals were more attracted to the entertainment zone containing the latest VR experiences and a 9D Cinema We tried the Cinema and thought it a little underwhelming. A small range of shops but on the floor above we discovered a clothes emporium with a great selection for men and women. We could not resist buying several quality items at price much cheaper than in the UK or Europe

This was our first visit to the food court at Marino Mall. First of all, the ambience is quite low end. From the furniture in the food court to the food served is quite ordinary. In fact it‚Äôs not unfair to say below par. We ordered food from the Mediterranean restaurant and the food wasn‚Äôt fresh and hardly had Mediterranean taste. All dishes were extremely ‚Äúoily‚Äù. The chairs in the Mediterranean food area were full of food stains! And the staff in the entire food court didn‚Äôt seem to have any concerns about the hygiene factor! All in all, the food court experience was quite below par and I suggest the management improves the standards in all areas before it‚Äôs too late.
In Colombo area  best place to enjoy the. Sunset ..and friendly staff DAMITH ,ASANGA,JIM thank you buddy..for the service

I have been to this building many times but I would never forget to visit their coffee shop in evening if I‚Äôm there. They have a wonderful items and vast range of tea along with many choices. Awesome view good service and very tasty. This is the ideal place to chill after a long day of work. Don‚Äôt forget to try their chocolate cake and Labukale estate  Tea or cinnamon Tea.

We visited the Marino Mall on a holiday visit to Sri Lanka and we were impressed. Located on the Marine Drive in Colombo 3 facing the Indian Ocean, it is a nice place to do shopping, have a meal or cuppa. The place is brand new with a variety of shops (fewer than other shopping malls such as Majestic City or Liberty Plaza) and ample underground parking. The food court is small but you will find good quality food at reasonable prices. The Labookele tea shop has the best tea that you can find in Colombo. The souvenir shop downstairs has a good collection including some impressive wooden carvings of good quality. I am not sure how long it will remain less crowded though.
Located conveniently in Colombo 03 Galle Road Good arcade for food , clothing and furniture Also apartments, bar and cafes

The place has some stores, but don't expect anything big. Some of the stuff, especially the toy shop is way over priced. The food court has some good tasty stuff, but of course the menu is limited. Overall, a crowded place, with a bit of shopping, some food and arcade manly for boy kids.
A brand new shopping mall in colombo. Many of branded products shops are available. Food court also great. Not cozy. Value for money.

New Shopping Mall in Colombo - Colpity. It's in Galle Road- Main road or Marine Drive. Have a lot of parking space. No charges for parking as of now. They have quite few shops for now. It will improve soon. And have kids play area. and there are few places to enjoy food as well.
This is a new mall.There are few high end shops.There is a cinema and games area.They have food court with a good selection of restaurants with inside and Sea view outside seating.

Finally a new place to take your kids in Colombo other than the usual places such as MC and Fun Factory. Marino mall is equiped with VR games and attractions its a bit expensive but worthwhile. The shops also are little different to those in other places. The only suggestion I have for the play area is instead of buying tickets for every single attraction is to have a card that can be topped up with credit so it can be used at all the attractions until the credit is topped up again rather than going to the counter everytime you need to visit an attraction. The food court looks nice especially with the outdoor area but the Far Eastern restaurant we tried sucked big time. We placed an order for the family only to find out that the ice tea on their menu should be taken from a different outlet, it seemed weird as it was printed on their menu. However the staff should be trained in handling their customers better. We ordered kway teo noodles which was ok but the Mee Goreng and the Nasi Goreng tasted absurd, not authentic and didnt seem fresh. I wouldn‚Äôt go that restaurant again but will definitely go to the play area with the kids.

One of the newest additions to Colombo's shopping destinations. Marino mall is built with an elegant interior with state of the art facilities. Though its not as huge as Majestic City or Liberty Plaza, it houses to a decent number of shops converting all kinds of goods. It also has a massive car park spread across 2 basement floors and a restaurant on the 1st floor with an amazing sea view, facilitating both indoor and outdoor seating.
Nothing much to see or do.  For kids ok. May be it will take time to complete. 1st floor shopping area is good

The 8th floor restaurant is the best part of this mall. They have two restaurants Chinese and a semi open bar and restaurant. Food is up to the standard, very reasonable for place as such, Nice clean place well mannered waiters. We drop in on a poya evening so no liquor was served, but the food was good. Only minus point is that most of the people visiting the mall just walk through the restaurant to get view of the surroundings. So the privacy of the diners and sometimes limited. Especially in the open restaurant.

My kids lovevthis place coz of play area with VR. 9D cinema is a dissapointment. But most of VR rides are supetb. Cafe looking down the ocean is great if there is less crowd. Love the fact there ate multiple cuisines to select from.

I always thought that the escalators in a mall bring people from 1 floor to the next. In the Marino Mall, they bring you right inside the shop. And it is pretty confusing. Whoever has thought this mall out, should have had a look at other malls... to get the idea. Lots of possibilities for arcade games, but for shopping, there is much left to be desired. Good for 1 visit not for a 2nd one.

This place was recently opened. It is been controlled by a leading Company in Sri Lanka.There are some shop spaces to be filled. 9D Cinema and the food court are very good. Also There are electronic shops Clothing's and may more to be purchased . Marino Hotel is situated in the same building.  There is a Chines restaurant in the 8 floor which has a nice city view.

Ground floor is one of easiest places to hangout with VR experience and as it‚Äôs in a very convenient location in Colombo lot of crowd gathering as a hot spot. Although they say it‚Äôs 9D cinema it‚Äôs about 7D in actual. But the best part is the 8th floor restaurant, actually they have two main restaurants in 8th floor. One is Chinese restaurant and the second one is a semi open bar and restaurant. Food is up to the standard, clean neat and nice and compare to other bars near by this seems to be more economical however there is no attractive view even though it‚Äôs a open bar (as construction going on near by and you can hardly see the beach view as  hotel is next to you ) Waiters dressed well and well mannered,with live music üéº Overall worth visit g again It cost me around LKR 1450 per person  for the night out. Depends with what you order obviously üòÉ

Marino mall is the newly opened mall by Damro and it's actually a pretty nice place anyone can enjoy. It's not a crazy happening place with Soo much of stalls but the places there are decent and affordable it's a good place to kill time with friends when bored. What I truly love are the restaurants they are really good, affordable and tasty and the portions are very generous. It's super fun to sit there during a rainy day because the winds are crazy. Lovely view with the refreshing sea breeze. It's definitely worth a visit we should support local enterprises stepping into big developments like this.
This is a small recently opened shopping mall. Construction work continues to be underway. Not somewhere for the average tourist unless keen on arcade games.

Just opened so maybe some changes will occur in the future - no atmosphere or vibe and few specialist or shopping outlets, I don't think this is for regular shoppers or tourists just commercial equipment and those looking for household items etc

This mall is small and the food court is mediocre. provides a great view but nothing else. good for kids but tends to get crowded during evenings. The shops are not so great either. Construction work is still ongoing.

Mall has two entrance from Galle road and Marine drive, it has sufficient enough parking slots. There are elevators all around, most of them are out of order or emergency only and they are too small for a huge mall,maximum 5-6 people fit in. also lifts are extreamly slow. Atmosphere is dull, shops, lighting and decorations could have been more trendy and modern. Food court seems lost, prices are reasonable but quality is low. Nothing much interesting and nothing tempting on display. Cleanliness can be improved. It's sad to see a massive new property like this failing even to meet average customer  expectation. View from the food court is superb
